Others: The Timberwolves lost their season opener to the Lakers with a score of 110-103.
The Wolves struggled offensively, shooting 41% from the field and 32% from 3-point range.
The Lakers outrebounded the Wolves 15-7 in the first quarter, leading to second-chance points.
The Wolves were outscored 72-40 in the paint by the Lakers.
Julius Randle made his regular-season NBA debut after undergoing season-ending shoulder surgery last season.
Joe Ingles was in the starting lineup for the Wolves, making his case for a spot in the rotation.
